solution_line_template: Two pairs of jeans would cost {num_jeans} * {cost_per_jeans} = $<<{num_jeans}*{cost_per_jeans}={cost_jeans}>>{cost_jeans}.
Four hats would in total cost {num_hats} * {cost_per_hat} = $<<{num_hats}*{cost_per_hat}={cost_hats}>>{cost_hats}.
So for three shirts, two pairs of jeans, and four hats, you would need to pay {cost_shirts} + {cost_jeans} + {cost_hats} = $<<{cost_shirts}+{cost_jeans}+{cost_hats}={total_cost}>>{total_cost}.
